item.content:encoded: Arena wins today also resets to 0 when looping (Thus allowing another use of the M-Ball)

item.title: TACO bonus counter
item.content:encoded: the TACO counter resets after looping. I think this should be mentioned here as well

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
ninjaon effect does loop, apparently.
ap booster effect loops, it's great for speedlooping. lasts all day.
none of the glowslinging daily bonuses loop, however 'duels remaining' does, so you can reget the +ap bonus a few loops a day. If you win three fights each season you're good to go. Trying for the appetite bonus is an alternative buuut then it would only help you in one season.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
do these effects loop?

- ninjaon
- boosters (i.e. AP booster)
- glowslinging bonusses (i think these dont?)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Dunno lol. 1m JXP… people will get that naturally, and the theme is useless anyway. I could delete the B-rank mention, or the theme entry itself, but well… there's not much point. Large parts of this page 'guide' are outdated… updating it would be… well if it was detailed, it would grow huge, and nobody would look at it. But if it was brief, it would be a whole lot of links to other pages, many of them people's opinions and debatable techniques… bvs isn't so straightforward as it once was. =/ Guides can be written but at the end of the day the fine tuning is all opinionated… that's why you need active villages and group chats that can help you. The wiki can only serve as an outline…
That's my opinion, anyway. Opinions aren't so great.
-Prince

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
"Most Jonin pull about 100,000 a day when running B-Rank missions if you need a rough estimate of how long this will take."

Why are Jonin doing B-rank missions for only 100,000 a day? I pull about 4 times that doing A-rank missions.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: You can eat ramen each day. If you ate ramen before looping that day, it counts as if you ate the ramen after the loop as well. Same goes for juice, storm, warrior's high and whatever else I might be forgetting that's limited by day.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: So, question. Does Ramen use loop, or are you SOL?

item.title: Hottie Regeneration
item.content:encoded:
Just saying (dont know for sure)

but Hottie Regeneration penalty loops as well. It's been discussed on the forums, that few big guys, messed up their speedloops due to it's effect.

EDIT: found a recent proof on the forums.

from oynotna [^]

Im speedlooping: two seasons/day, not hard to do if you have the right setup. Thanks to some TACOS hate, I was 20 stamina away from my next season. Checking my options, the only stuff left was: consuming my Senjutsu Reserves, and Hottie Regen. Hey, Im not using jutsu while speedlooping, so lets use the Regen…

I looped, but now my chakra is sealed and I cant finish the Jonin exam, cause I need jutsu for the two 99d/99s check. FML.

item.title: flip out
item.content:encoded: Thanks Redgoblin, Sam510 just fixed it.

item.title: error in "filp out" theme
item.content:encoded: guys, the theme "Flip Out" gives +25% XP/AP on regular missions not +10%

item.title: Level cap
item.content:encoded:
Hey again. I saw someone changed the table back to a 'max level cap of 53' with KF and without, however unfortunately this does not seem to be true. I fought a season 20 player in the arena today who had 63 tai levels. He had the knightmare frame but did not appear to have the Mark 86 (which, now that I mention it, also could use adding to the table). I have no way of knowing if he is able to reach level 64 and above, but considering how he's a clean ten levels over the 'level cap', it's no small thing. I would suggest moving some of this information over to the 'levels' page, as it is cluttering this page which is supposed to be for looping. Personally I think a link to the looping page and a summary would be the best solution- i.e. the 'can loop' levels and the amount of cumulative ap needed to reach those levels in one table. Perhaps a column for 'ap to next level' on the higher levels' (15+).
Anyone? If nobody replies this time I might make changes myself. You know, it's kinda a liiiiittle bit important.

item.title: When can I loop/level?
item.content:encoded:
Hey guys, two things. Firstly can someone confirm that the level cap keeps increasing with season?

Secondly, I like the 'When do I level?' section (thanks rveach2!), I was thinking maybe we could supplement it with a column for cumulative AP. It wouldn't take up any more space on the page, being a column, and it may help some people. I don't see how it could do any harm, what do you think? =)

item.title: Daily bonus
item.content:encoded: The counter no longer resets now and has been changed, I think this needs to be added in now.

item.title: Suggestion: Perm Bloodlines
item.content:encoded: There are apparently a few bloodlines (Greass, for one) that are NOT lost when looping, while most are; would it be good to note these as a priority to get? Especially if they count towards the # of bloodlines requirements for the Sannin S2+ Jonin advancement quests?

item.title: Fixes
item.content:encoded: I fixed some minor defects while I was fixing the looping lower limit issue, but this still could use quite a bit of work.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: The whole page needs a pretty major overhaul, mainly because it still heavily references the NWW and the old Arena.

item.title: Remove NWW References?
item.content:encoded: Should NWW references be removed from this page? As it no longer exists, I imagine the references are more confusing than helpful.

item.title: Looping
item.content:encoded: You always revert to day 2 when you loop no matter what day number you are on. But ya it is best to loop on a 7 day bonus (after stam used)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Something worth mentioning, happened to me this time - if you loop when you have a number of consecutive bonus days (over 7, I had 15 or so), after looping, the large number isn't remembered, reverting back to 2 or whatever number was closest to 7. So if you're thinking of looping and you're close to 14 or 21 days, you should wait for them to get the extra points that come with them.

To maximize one's profit as a genin, as said above, it's better you loop in day 6 or so.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Thanks TheData, and what if you use some of your stamina before looping? let say you use all your stamina until you have 150 left, and then, you loop, will your genin have 150 stamina like all other genin?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
since you revert to a lvl 6 character you will no longer have your daily sannin stamina. you'll start with a daily genin stamina
also the daily bonuses won't reset since they are counted DAILY…

item.title: Stamina when looping?
item.content:encoded:
What's the deal with your stamina when you loop? Do you keep your Sannin stamina, or you only get Genin Stamina?

What happens? What about the daily bonuses?

So, are you better off burning all your stam, looping, and then playing some more, or how does it work?

item.title: Important: Unlock: The Road to Womanhood error!
item.content:encoded: With the new requirements of getting Nedesko it is no longer possible to use floating on air and a Mood enhancer to get her. You have to do it entirely by friend points now.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: You keep your village when you loop.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Do you keep your village when you loop? Or you have to re-apply?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: The Special Mission to Loop requires no Stamina to take, and you can back out of it. You can get many Themes in S1, and you can check what you need to do from the Looping Guide, and check on your progress by going into the Special Mission, reading it, and then going "Back to Main". Even if you don't select the "Back to Main," it won't have you "saved" as on that Special Mission.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: How do you know when you unlock a theme? And can themes be unlocked in Season 1? (I know they can't be used til Season 2, but say I got 45 allies in S1, will I get the Theme All Together Now when I hit S2?)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: The NWW items from season 1 now loop as well. This should be updated… I suppose I'll do it.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: This is missing the themes Ascension, Flip Out, Good Night Ninja, Hey Hey We're the Ninja, and Stand By Your Ninja. Basically all the ones you get automatically, except for Ascension.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Heres the text for looping, if anyone thinks it should be added.

A New Season
Out of nowhere, a ghostly figure appears, shuffling a stack of papers and muttering to himself.
"Good, good, this one seems to be doing really well. We'll have to sign them up for another Season."
You can *hear* the capital letter on that word, 'Season'.
He looks up at you. "Yeah, I'm talking to you. You up for it? Another Season? Here, let me see what we can do about getting you some better press - how about a spiffy new Theme Song?" You have no idea what he's talking about. "You know, that song, the one that plays before each Episode? You probably catch yourself humming it from time to time." Whoa, you think he might be on to something there…
It's Time for another Season!
You'll be a brand new Genin (you may want to donate your Ryo to a Village before you loop - you lose 25% of it. Also, you lose all of your items except what is listed below, and your daily bonus stamina counter is reset), but with lots of new stuff unlocked, special abilities, and even a new character trait, Themes! You can choose one of each type of Theme per day to help you play.

It then list all of the items you have that loop, and asks you to pick your next bloodline.

A white door opens in the distance, and you hear music that is hauntingly familiar.. you are drawn to it, and pass through..
Welcome to Season 2!

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: So it seems you can loop even before you get the warning. Right after I hit 18 in Genjutsu, the Loop special mission popped up. So, i guess, you can loop 2 levels before you absolutely _have_ to. No idea how or where to put this in the article, though…

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Just hit level 20 in Ninjutsu and received this message:

Level Cap! Your character is currently in Season 1. As such, you may have a maximum of 20 in any one stat. Once you hit that, this message appears. A Special Mission has opened up, allowing you to reach a whole new level of play. Good luck! (You have a few days from hitting the cap to start a new season before your Stamina is cut. In 14 days, you will no longer be able to level up until you loop, and the Writers may start cutting the budget (Stamina and Stamina Bonuses) of your show! Number of days so far - 1)

I figured that the level cap message should probably be put on this page somewhere, but I'm not sure where so I'll leave it up to someone else to do it.
